intro: Astragalus fresenii, commonly known as the Sierra grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus fresenii is often found in open habitats such as slopes, meadows, and along stream banks.
